solution_line_template: Two less than three times the original number of turtles is ({original_turtles}*{multiplier})-{subtractor}=<<{original_turtles}*{multiplier}-{subtractor}={new_turtles_climbed}>>{new_turtles_climbed}.

Thus, The original {original_turtles} were joined by {new_turtles_climbed} more, for a total of {new_turtles_climbed}+{original_turtles}=<<{original_turtles}+{new_turtles_climbed}={total_turtles_on_log}>>{total_turtles_on_log} turtles.

But half of the {total_turtles_on_log} turtles scurried away, leaving half remaining, or {total_turtles_on_log}/{divisor}=<<{total_turtles_on_log}/{divisor}={remaining_turtles}>>{remaining_turtles} brave turtles
